revised_title: Spontaneous Crystallization of Monochloracetic Acid and its Mixtures with Naphthalene
tldr: The authors investigate the spontaneous crystallization of monochloracetic acid and its mixtures with naphthalene, discovering that each modification of the acid has a distinct temperature of spontaneous crystallization in its mixtures with naphthalene. They also find that mixtures of monochloracetic acid and naphthalene can exhibit up to eight freezing points.
